text: The women's high jump competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 13 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Joni Huntley of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |2.01 |Prague, Czechoslovakia |August 31, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |1.89 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All heights shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Height !Notes |- | |Louise Ritter | |1.93 |GR |- | |Pam Spencer | |1.87 | |- | |Debbie Brill | |1.85 | |- | |Julie White | |1.85 | |- | |Maria Domingues | |1.83 | |- | |Angela Carbonell | |1.81 | |- | |Elizabeth Huber | |1.74 | |- | |Silvia Costa | |1.74 | |- | |Liliana Arigoni | |1.74 | |- |10 |Rafaela Flores | |1.55 | |- | |Ana Hidalgo | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Women's high jump
